intro: Calonyction bona-nox subvar. pubescens, commonly known as the night-blooming star of Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped, white flowers that open at night and close by dawn. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique flowering habit, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and botanical collections.
